title: Roman type
content:
Hi

I took this picture in Rome. Any idea if there is an existing type that matches?

Thanks

Clinton

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130322063834im_/http:/typophile.com/files/cine_5264.jpg)
author: cisfor

comments.content:
Looks like this mysterious [Stahl’s Tiffany](http://web.archive.org/web/20130322063834/http:/www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/forum/viewthread.php?threadid=107590). A similar font would be [URW Wood Type](http://web.archive.org/web/20130322063834/http:/www.identifont.com/show?67D).

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130322063834im_/http:/typophile.com/files/l_tiffany_big_5794.gif)

I searched "western" on MyFonts and found  
FontMesa's [Saloon Girl](http://web.archive.org/web/20130322063834/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontmesa/saloon-girl/) and [Lynchburg](http://web.archive.org/web/20130322063834/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontmesa/lynchburg/)  
URW [Wood Type D](http://web.archive.org/web/20130322063834/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/wood-type/)  
and more.
Thanks guys. The Stahl's Tiffany is very close - just a small discrepancy with the differing weight of the A strokes. But close enough for my purposes. Thanks again!
Why are the fonts named Tiffany all a little bizarre and ornate?
